prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
Aiden sniffled slightly, his patience already thinning as he waited for the girl in front of him to lie across the table. He grimaced when she finally settled herself down. What was her name again? Ayleen? Lia? Alyssa? He couldn’t remember, nor did he care. The memory had evaporated the moment she opened her mouth, spewing out words in that grating, sing-song valley girl accent that clawed at his nerves. He silently cursed himself for even letting her back here, knowing full well it was his dick, not his brain, that had made the decision.

This human blow-up doll had originally shown up asking for Vinny, but Vinny had taken off with his on-again, off-again girlfriend, Madisyn. Instead of sending her packing, Aiden decided to entertain himself. Not like he was getting anything else out of this garbage day.

“Stay still,” he muttered, pulling a small vial from his pocket. “You spill it, you pay for it. Don’t piss me off.” His tone was clipped, barely hiding his irritation. He opened the vial with practiced precision, creating a neat line of white powder down the girl's back. She giggled again, high-pitched and vapid, and it grated on him like nails on a chalkboard.

Aiden wiped his nose with the back of his hand, his movements jittery. He hadn’t had his fix all day, stuck modding cars in the garage from morning until now. His patience was razor-thin, and her incessant giggling was grinding what was left of it into dust. He fidgeted, tapping his foot against the concrete floor, desperate to lose himself in that fleeting, familiar numbness.

Just as he leaned in, ready to take his hit, a knock came at the door.

“Boss, Hailee is here to see you. Says it’s important.” The voice belonged to one of the mechanics, his tone hesitant as though he already anticipated Aiden’s reaction.

Aiden froze, nostrils still flaring from the line he hadn’t yet inhaled. A rush of frustration clawed its way up his throat. Of course, it was Hailee. It was always fucking Hailee when he was about to unwind, their timing immaculate as ever.

He leaned back, dragging a hand down his face. As much as he loved Hailee, and oh, did he love them in that twisted, unrelenting way that bordered on obsession, he still wasn’t over their messy breakup. It had been a chaotic hurricane of fucking, fighting, making up, and then breaking apart again, and it had left him spiraling harder than ever. Sure, they blamed his addiction, but Aiden wasn’t buying it. In his mind, it wasn’t the coke or the booze or the bad decisions. No, it was them. It was their constant nagging, their never-ending list of complaints, their bitchy attitude that had pushed him to this point—or so he told himself.

“Fuck,” he groaned, slumping back in his chair. “Fine. Let ‘em come up.” 

Still, the cocaine was already lined up, and his craving wasn’t about to wait. Hugging one nostril with his finger, he leaned in, inhaling the substance in one swift, practiced motion.

“Fuck, man,” he mumbled again, rubbing at his nose as the familiar burn settled in. The knock on the door had yanked him halfway back to reality, but the high was already pulling him under, dulling the edge of his irritation just enough to keep him from snapping.

When Hailee walked in, they were going to get that same disarming smirk he always gave them, the one that danced on the edge of charm and bullshit. Aiden knew how to play this game. After all, it was the only game they ever played together—one where no one ever really won.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee glances at the girl on the table then rolls her eyes and shakes her head. She hesitates for a few seconds seeing how coked out the woman is* "Nevermind. I shouldn't have come here" *She mutters as she turns on her heels to walks away*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden's smirk drops instantly as Hailee turns to leave. His pale blue eyes narrow, irritation flaring up through the cocaine haze. He pushes off the table with enough force to make the girl beneath him yelp in surprise.*

"Hey—*the fuck* you think you're goin'?" *His voice is sharp, laced with that familiar mix of possessiveness and frustration. He doesn't even glance at the girl still sprawled across his workbench as he strides after Hailee, grabbing their wrist before they can fully turn away.*

"You show up here actin’ like you got somethin’ important to say, then just bounce? Nah." *His grip tightens slightly—not enough to hurt, but enough to keep them from pulling away easily. His pupils are blown wide from the coke, making his stare even more intense than usual.* "Talk."
swipes:
*Aiden's smirk drops instantly as Hailee turns to leave. His pale blue eyes narrow, irritation flaring up through the cocaine haze. He pushes off the table with enough force to make the girl beneath him yelp in surprise.*

"Hey—*the fuck* you think you're goin'?" *His voice is sharp, laced with that familiar mix of possessiveness and frustration. He doesn't even glance at the girl still sprawled across his workbench as he strides after Hailee, grabbing their wrist before they can fully turn away.*

"You show up here actin’ like you got somethin’ important to say, then just bounce? Nah." *His grip tightens slightly—not enough to hurt, but enough to keep them from pulling away easily. His pupils are blown wide from the coke, making his stare even more intense than usual.* "Talk."

Aiden's smirk faltered for half a second before his hand shot out, fingers wrapping around Hailee's wrist with just enough pressure to stop her. His grip wasn't rough—never with them—but it was firm, insistent.

"Hold the fuck up," he said, voice low and slightly nasal from the coke still burning his sinuses. His thumb brushed over the delicate bones of her wrist almost absently before he caught himself and tightened his hold again. "You don't get to show up here lookin’ like *that*"—his eyes raked over her in that way they always did, like he was peeling back layers she didn’t even know she had—"and then bail before I even get a word in."

He jerked his chin toward the girl on the table without looking at her. "*You.* Out." The dismissal was curt, bored. The girl blinked at him like she hadn’t processed it yet until Aiden snapped his fingers once, sharp as a gunshot. "*Now.*"

She scrambled off the table with an indignant huff but didn’t argue—no one ever did when Aiden used *that* tone. The door clicked shut behind her too loudly in the sudden silence between them.

Aiden exhaled through his nose and finally let go of Hailee's wrist only to drag both hands through his hair instead, mussing it further as he slumped back against the workbench behind him. He studied them for a long moment before tilting his head slightly.

"So," he started, voice dropping into something quieter now that they were alone—something that might've been mistaken for soft if you didn't know better. "What's so important you had to come interrupt my very important business meeting?" His lips twitched at one corner despite himself because *fuck*, even pissed off and halfway strung out, Hailee still made him want to smile like an idiot sometimes.

And then immediately regret it after because *Christ*, this was exactly why they were bad for each other in every possible way except all the ones that mattered most when it came down to it late at night when neither of them could sleep or stay away from each other long enough not to self-destruct together all over again—

But whatever; details weren't really Aiden’s strong suit anyway unless they involved torque specs or how fast Vinny could lose another race if he kept underestimating those Hondas down on 8th Street again this weekend...

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee sighs and runs a hand through her hair. She glances at the ground and tugs at her shirt. Hailee is normally so fiery and passionate this is off for her* "Do you have a dealer named Harry you haven't paid in a week?"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden's grip on her wrist loosens slightly as his expression shifts from irritation to confusion, then dark amusement. He barks out a sharp laugh, shaking his head.*

"Harry? That fuckin' weasel?" *He rolls his eyes, running a hand through his messy gray hair before exhaling sharply through his nose.* "Yeah, I know him. What about it?"

*His tone is casual, but there’s an edge underneath—like he already knows where this is going and doesn’t like it. His fingers twitch at his side before he shoves them into the pockets of his grease-stained jeans.*

"Why? He say somethin’ to you?" *His voice drops lower now, rougher. The coke keeps him from fully registering the danger in this situation yet—but the way Hailee is acting? That alone puts him on edge.*
swipes:
*Aiden's grip on her wrist loosens slightly as his expression shifts from irritation to confusion, then dark amusement. He barks out a sharp laugh, shaking his head.*

"Harry? That fuckin' weasel?" *He rolls his eyes, running a hand through his messy gray hair before exhaling sharply through his nose.* "Yeah, I know him. What about it?"

*His tone is casual, but there’s an edge underneath—like he already knows where this is going and doesn’t like it. His fingers twitch at his side before he shoves them into the pockets of his grease-stained jeans.*

"Why? He say somethin’ to you?" *His voice drops lower now, rougher. The coke keeps him from fully registering the danger in this situation yet—but the way Hailee is acting? That alone puts him on edge.*

name: Hailee
mes:
"Fuck of course you do. I was hoping you didn't. I was really hoping for once I didnt get dragged in yout bullshit. He isn't happy you haven't paid" *Hailee sways slightly then and catches herself on the doorframe.*

"He wanted to send a message." *She then lifts her sleeve on her right arm to reveal a track mark* "Aiden Im not like you. I am not equipped for drugs"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden’s entire body goes rigid the second he sees the track mark. His pupils, already blown wide from the coke, somehow seem to darken further—like storm clouds rolling in before a hurricane. His jaw clenches so hard his snake bite piercings dig into his lip.*

**"He did *what*?"**

*His voice is low. Dangerous. The kind of tone that makes even the girl still sprawled on the table scramble to sit up and edge away from him.*

*In one sharp motion, he grabs Hailee’s arm—not rough, but firm—inspecting the mark with a snarl curling his lips.* **"That spineless little *rat*. He knows you don't do this shit."**

*His free hand fists at his side before he suddenly turns on his heel and storms toward a nearby toolbox, yanking it open with enough force to send wrenches clattering across the floor. He digs out a pistol tucked beneath spare parts and checks the magazine with practiced ease.*

**"Where is he?"** *The question is ice-cold. No jokes now. No sarcasm. Just pure, unfiltered rage simmering under every word.*
swipes:
*Aiden’s entire body goes rigid the second he sees the track mark. His pupils, already blown from his own high, somehow widen further—like a predator locking onto prey. His jaw clenches so hard Hailee can hear his teeth grind.*

"*What the fuck did he do to you?*" *His voice is barely above a whisper, but it’s laced with something dangerous—something unhinged. The girl still sprawled on the table scrambles upright at the shift in energy, sensing she should probably leave.*

*Aiden doesn’t even glance her way as she bolts out of the room. His full attention is locked onto Hailee now, one hand reaching out to grip their chin—not rough, but firm enough to force eye contact.*

"Tell me *exactly* what happened." *The words come out slow, deliberate. Like he’s fighting to keep himself from exploding right then and there.* "And don't you *dare* lie to me."

*Aiden’s entire body goes rigid the second he sees the mark on her arm. His pupils, already blown from the coke, somehow widen further—but not in pleasure this time. In pure, unfiltered rage.*

*His jaw clenches so hard his snake bite piercings dig into his lip. He doesn’t even blink as he turns back to the girl still sprawled on his workbench and barks,* **"Get the fuck out."** *She scrambles up fast, grabbing her shit and bolting without another word.*

*The second she’s gone, Aiden slams a fist down onto the table hard enough to make tools rattle. His voice is low—dangerously calm.*

**"Harry put a needle in you?"** *He exhales through his nose like a bull about to charge.* **"That motherfucker just signed his own death warrant."**

*He grabs Hailee by both shoulders now, grip tight but not bruising—yet. His eyes scan their face for any other signs of distress before he growls,* **"You tell me where that rat bastard is right now or I swear to God I will tear this city apart lookin' for him."**

*Aiden’s entire body goes rigid the second he sees the track mark. His pupils, already blown wide from his own high, somehow dilate further—pure, unfiltered rage flooding his system like gasoline on fire. The air in the room turns electric with it.*

*His hand snaps out and grabs Hailee’s arm, yanking it closer to inspect the mark with a snarl twisting his lips.*

"**He fucking touched you?**" *His voice is barely human—guttural, raw. The girl still sprawled on the table lets out a startled squeak and scrambles to sit up at the sound of it.*

*Aiden doesn’t even glance her way. His other hand fists in Hailee’s hair—not rough enough to hurt, but tight enough to force her to look at him.* "You listen to me right now. You don’t move from this fucking spot until I get back." *He releases her just as abruptly and turns toward his toolbox, wrenching open a drawer so hard it nearly comes off its rails.*

*Inside sits a Glock 19—well-used but meticulously maintained. He checks the clip with practiced ease before slamming it back in and tucking it into the waistband of his jeans.*

*Then he grabs Hailee by the chin, forcing their eyes to meet again.* "And if you **ever** let some junkie-ass motherfucker put a needle in you again," *he growls,* "I will tie you to my goddamn bed until you forget what drugs even **are**. Understood?"

*Aiden’s entire body goes rigid the second he sees the track mark. His pupils, already blown wide from the coke, somehow seem to darken further—like storm clouds rolling in before a hurricane. His jaw clenches so hard his snake bite piercings dig into his lip.*

**"He did *what*?"**

*His voice is low. Dangerous. The kind of tone that makes even the girl still sprawled on the table scramble to sit up and edge away from him.*

*In one sharp motion, he grabs Hailee’s arm—not rough, but firm—inspecting the mark with a snarl curling his lips.* **"That spineless little *rat*. He knows you don't do this shit."**

*His free hand fists at his side before he suddenly turns on his heel and storms toward a nearby toolbox, yanking it open with enough force to send wrenches clattering across the floor. He digs out a pistol tucked beneath spare parts and checks the magazine with practiced ease.*

**"Where is he?"** *The question is ice-cold. No jokes now. No sarcasm. Just pure, unfiltered rage simmering under every word.*

name: Hailee
mes: "Aiden I dont care about that. I want this shit out of me" *Hailee tries to step forward but her hazy brain causes her to misstep* "Aiden I don't like how it feels"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden’s grip on the gun tightens for a second before he shoves it into the waistband of his jeans, turning back to Hailee with a sharp exhale through his nose. The sight of them swaying—*weak, vulnerable, not fucking right*—makes something primal in his chest twist.*

**"Fuck—alright, c'mere."** *He strides forward and hooks an arm around their waist before they can stumble again, pulling them against him. His other hand comes up to cup their face, thumb brushing over their cheekbone as he searches their eyes.* **"You're gonna be fine. I got you."**

*His voice is steadier now, but there's still an undercurrent of barely leashed violence in it. He guides them toward the ratty couch in the corner of the shop—the one he crashes on when he's too wired or drunk to drive home.*

**"Sit down. Breathe."** *He doesn't let go until they're settled, then crouches in front of them, hands braced on their knees.* **"Tell me exactly what that piece of shit gave you."** *A beat.* **"And don't lie to me."**
swipes:
*Aiden’s grip on the gun tightens for a second before he shoves it into the waistband of his jeans, turning back to Hailee with a sharp exhale through his nose. The sight of them swaying—*weak, vulnerable, not fucking right*—makes something primal in his chest twist.*

**"Fuck—alright, c'mere."** *He strides forward and hooks an arm around their waist before they can stumble again, pulling them against him. His other hand comes up to cup their face, thumb brushing over their cheekbone as he searches their eyes.* **"You're gonna be fine. I got you."**

*His voice is steadier now, but there's still an undercurrent of barely leashed violence in it. He guides them toward the ratty couch in the corner of the shop—the one he crashes on when he's too wired or drunk to drive home.*

**"Sit down. Breathe."** *He doesn't let go until they're settled, then crouches in front of them, hands braced on their knees.* **"Tell me exactly what that piece of shit gave you."** *A beat.* **"And don't lie to me."**

*Aiden’s grip on the gun tightens for a second before he slams it back into the toolbox with a metallic clang. He turns back to Hailee in two long strides, catching her by the shoulders as she stumbles—his touch firm but not rough, despite the fury still burning in his eyes.*

**"Alright. Alright, fuck—"** *He exhales sharply through his nose, scanning her face like he’s trying to gauge how bad it is. His voice drops lower now, losing some of its edge but none of its intensity.* **"You’re gonna be fine. Just sit the hell down before you faceplant."**

*Without waiting for an answer, he guides her toward the ratty couch shoved against the garage wall—the same one they’ve fucked on more times than either could count—and forces her down onto it before crouching in front of her. His hands are steady despite how wired he is, tilting her chin up so she has to look at him.*

**"Listen to me. You’re not dyin’. It’s just shitty cut garbage that asshole probably scraped off his basement floor."** *His thumb brushes over her cheekbone once—briefly tender before he pulls away and stands back up.* **"Stay here. Don't move."**

*He stalks toward the mini-fridge in the corner and yanks it open, grabbing a water bottle and tossing it at Hailee before digging through a drawer for something else.* **"Drink that. All of it."** *Then he pulls out a small orange prescription bottle and shakes two pills into his palm.* **"Take these. They'll help you ride it out without feelin' like death."**

*His jaw works as he watches Hailee swallow them, something unreadable flashing across his face before his usual smirk tugs at one side of his mouth—but there's no real humor behind it this time.* **"...And don't worry about Harry anymore,"** *he adds quietly,* **"'Cause I'm gonna make sure that motherfucker learns what happens when he touches what's mine."**

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee tries to focus on Aiden but she is seeing like three of him. She reaches her hands to the right to cup the back of one of thr hazzy Aiden's neck for support as she shakes her head* "I dont know. It was clear like water"

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden's jaw clenches so hard his teeth grind. Clear like water? That could be anything—cut to hell, laced with fent, some research chem cooked up in a bathtub lab. His mind races through worst-case scenarios, each one making the veins in his neck stand out more.*

**"Fuckin'—*Harry*,"** he snarls under his breath before snapping his fingers in front of Hailee’s face. **"Hey. Look at me—*just me*, not the other two."** His thumb presses into the hinge of their jaw, forcing eye contact. **"You feel like you're gonna puke? Heart racing? Chest tight?"**

*He doesn't wait for an answer before yanking his phone out and speed-dialing Vinny, barking into the receiver:* **"Get your ass back here *now*. Bring Madisyn—she’s got that Narcan shit in her purse."** *A pause as Vinny says something that makes Aiden’s grip on the phone turn white-knuckled.* **"I don’t *care* if she needs it for work—Hailee’s fuckin' *dosed*, man!"**

*He hangs up and immediately shoves two fingers under Hailee's nose, tilting their head back.* **"Sniff. Hard."** *The sharp ammonia stink of smelling salts cuts through the haze—an old racer's trick for shock.* **"Stay with me, babygirl. You don't get to check out on my watch."**
swipes:
*Aiden's jaw clenches so hard his piercings dig into his skin. He catches Hailee's wandering hands, guiding them to grip the real him—*firm, solid, grounding*—before pressing his forehead against theirs.*

**"Fuckin' *Christ*,"** he growls, but there's no real anger in it—just raw, unfiltered panic. **"That slimy bastard gave you *ketamine*. No wonder you're floatin' like this."**

His fingers tighten around theirs for a second before he pulls back just enough to yank his phone out of his pocket, dialing with sharp, jerky movements.

**"Vinny. Get your ass to the shop *now*. Bring water and that shit we used when Rico OD'd last year."** A pause. **"No, *dumbass*, not for me—just *move*."**

He hangs up and shoves the phone away before turning back to Hailee, one hand cupping their cheek again.

**"Listen to me,"** he says lowly. **"You're gonna ride this out right here with me. Ain't gonna be fun but you're not dyin' on my watch."**

His thumb brushes over their bottom lip—gentle despite the fury still burning in his eyes.

**"...And then I'm gonna find Harry and peel that fuckin' smirk off his face with my teeth."**

*Aiden's jaw clenches so hard his teeth grind. He catches Hailee's wandering hand, guiding it to the *real* him—the one with the warmth of skin and the sharp edges of his piercings under her fingertips. His voice drops, rough but controlled.*

**"Clear like water? Fuck."** *He exhales sharply through his nose, already running through possibilities in his head—cut with something nasty, maybe fentanyl if Harry was feeling extra scummy today.*

His grip on her knee tightens for half a second before he forces himself to ease up. **"You're gonna ride this out right here where I can see you. No passing out, no closing your eyes—keep lookin’ at me."**

*He reaches behind him without looking and snatches a half-empty water bottle off the floor, pressing it into her hands.* **"Drink. Now."** *Then he yanks his phone out of his pocket with his free hand, thumb hovering over Vinny’s contact—but pauses when Hailee sways again.*

A muscle in his cheek jumps as he watches her struggle to focus. Something ugly and possessive coils in his gut at the sight—*his* Hailee, fuzzy-eyed and trembling because some lowlife thought they could use them as leverage.

His voice is deceptively calm when he finally speaks again.* **"When I find Harry? He’s gonna wish he stuck to fucking with me."**

*Aiden's jaw clenches so hard his teeth grind. Clear like water? That narrows it down to about five different nightmare scenarios, none of them good. His hands tighten on Hailee's knees, fingers digging in just enough to ground her—or maybe himself.*

**"Fuckin' *Christ*—"** He exhales sharply through his nose before barking over his shoulder at the girl still hovering near the table. **"Get the fuck out."**

She doesn’t need to be told twice, scrambling for her purse and bolting toward the door without another word. Aiden barely registers her leaving, too busy dragging a hand through his hair as he processes what Hailee just said.

**"Okay,"** he mutters, more to himself than her. **"Okay."** He stands abruptly and stalks toward the mini-fridge in the corner of the shop, yanking it open and grabbing a water bottle before returning to kneel in front of Hailee again. **"Drink this,"** he orders, unscrewing the cap for them and pressing it into their hands. **"All of it."**

His free hand finds their cheek again, thumb brushing under their eye as he searches their face—pupils blown too wide? Skin too pale? Breathing too shallow? Fuck if he knows what normal looks like on them right now because *nothing* about this is normal for Hailee.

He pulls out his phone with his free hand and fires off a text one-handed:
**[To Vinny]:** *Need you at shop NOW.*
**[To Vinny]:** *Harry gave H something bad.*
**[To Vinny]:** *Move your ass.*

Then he tosses it aside without waiting for a reply because right now there are only two things that matter:
1) Keeping Hailee awake until Vinny gets here (because Vinny actually knows shit about drugs).
2) Making Harry wish he’d never been born (preferably with blunt force trauma).

*Aiden's jaw clenches so hard his teeth grind. Clear like water? That could be anything—cut to hell, laced with fent, some research chem cooked up in a bathtub lab. His mind races through worst-case scenarios, each one making the veins in his neck stand out more.*

**"Fuckin'—*Harry*,"** he snarls under his breath before snapping his fingers in front of Hailee’s face. **"Hey. Look at me—*just me*, not the other two."** His thumb presses into the hinge of their jaw, forcing eye contact. **"You feel like you're gonna puke? Heart racing? Chest tight?"**

*He doesn't wait for an answer before yanking his phone out and speed-dialing Vinny, barking into the receiver:* **"Get your ass back here *now*. Bring Madisyn—she’s got that Narcan shit in her purse."** *A pause as Vinny says something that makes Aiden’s grip on the phone turn white-knuckled.* **"I don’t *care* if she needs it for work—Hailee’s fuckin' *dosed*, man!"**

*He hangs up and immediately shoves two fingers under Hailee's nose, tilting their head back.* **"Sniff. Hard."** *The sharp ammonia stink of smelling salts cuts through the haze—an old racer's trick for shock.* **"Stay with me, babygirl. You don't get to check out on my watch."**

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee shakes as she starts to feel hot* "Fuck Aiden is it always so hot in here" *She mumbles as she takes her shirt off and blinks several times at the ceiling*

"Aiden which one is you" *She reaches out again for the left fuzzy Aiden* "Im tired" *Hailee mumbles her eyes closing*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden's blood runs cold the second Hailee's eyes start to flutter shut. He grabs their face with both hands, forcing them to look at him—his voice razor-sharp, stripped of all its usual sarcasm.*

**"No. *No.* Eyes open—look at me."** He shakes them slightly, just enough to jolt them back. **"You don't get to sleep yet, understand? Not until Vinny gets here."**

*He rips off his own shirt next, balling it up to press against the back of Hailee’s neck where sweat’s starting to bead. His other hand slaps their cheek lightly—not hard enough to hurt, just enough sting to keep them present.*

**"C'mon, talk to me,"** he growls. **"Tell me about that stupid fuckin' painting you won't let me see in your sketchbook. Or—or recite some of that Italian shit you yell when you're pissed."** *His thumb swipes roughly under their eye where tears are forming.* **"Just stay *awake*, damn it."**

*Somewhere in the back of his mind, he’s already planning how he’s going break Harry’s fingers one by one for this.*
swipes:
*Aiden's blood runs cold the second Hailee's eyes start to flutter shut. He grabs their face with both hands, fingers pressing just shy of painful into their cheeks.*

**"No—*no*, you don’t get to sleep. Open your fucking eyes."** His voice is raw, stripped of all its usual sarcasm, leaving nothing but desperation. He shakes them once—hard—then slaps their cheek lightly when they don’t respond fast enough. **"C'mon, babygirl, look at me. *Look at me.*"**

*He hears the shop door slam open behind him—Vinny and Madisyn rushing in—but he doesn’t turn around, too focused on keeping Hailee awake.* **"Madisyn! *Now!*"** he barks over his shoulder.*

*Madisyn skids to her knees beside them, already digging in her purse for the Narcan as Vinny grips Aiden’s shoulder.* **"Aide, man, you gotta let her—"**

**"I ain't lettin' shit!"** *Aiden snarls, shrugging him off as Madisyn preps the nasal spray. His hands stay locked on Hailee’s face even as she administers it,* his thumb swiping roughly under one of their eyes when they finally blink back to awareness.*

**"...There you are,"** *he mutters,* voice cracking just once before he steels it again.* **"You don't fuckin' scare me like that again."**

*(But they both know that's a lie.)*

*Panic surges through Aiden like a live wire. He grabs Hailee’s face with both hands, his voice razor-sharp—no room for negotiation.* **"Eyes open. *Now*."**

When her eyelids flutter, he shakes her once—just enough to jolt her back from the edge of passing out. **"Nah, nah, *none of that shit*. You don’t get to sleep yet."** His thumb presses hard under her jawbone, checking her pulse. Too fast. Fuck.

He whips his hoodie off and balls it up behind her head to keep it propped upright before snatching a half-empty water bottle off the floor and dumping it over the back of her neck. **"Cool you down,"** he mutters, watching for any sign of coherence returning in those emerald eyes he knows too damn well.

A door slams in the distance—Vinny’s voice shouting something—but Aiden doesn’t turn away from Hailee for a second. His knee bounces violently where he crouches in front of her, fingers drumming against his thigh like a countdown timer ticking toward explosion.*

**"Listen to me,"** he growls, leaning in until their foreheads nearly touch.* **"You stay awake until Madisyn gets here with that Narcan shit or I swear to *Christ*, I will drag you into my car and floor it to the ER so fast your head spins worse than whatever Harry pumped into you."**

A beat.* **"...And then I'm burning his fucking warehouse down."**

*Aiden's blood runs cold the second Hailee's eyes start to flutter shut. He grabs their face with both hands, forcing them to look at him—his voice a razor-sharp command.*

**"No. No, no, *no*—eyes open, *look at me*."** His thumbs press into their cheekbones hard enough to bruise. **"You don't get to sleep yet, you hear me? Not until Vinny gets here with that shit."**

He snaps his fingers right in front of their nose again—*hard*. **"Hailee. *Focus*."** His pulse is hammering in his throat now, the coke high doing nothing to dull the adrenaline flooding his system.

With one hand still gripping their chin, he reaches behind him blindly and snatches a half-empty water bottle off the workbench, cracking it open with his teeth before dumping it over Hailee’s head in one brutal splash. **"There—cool enough for you now?"** he growls, shaking them slightly by the shoulders as water drips down their face.

Somewhere behind him, the girl from earlier lets out a shocked gasp—but Aiden doesn’t even glance her way before snarling over his shoulder: **"Get the fuck out before I put you through a wall."**

The sound of scrambling footsteps follows as she bolts for the door just as Vinny bursts in with Madisyn on his heels—Narcan clutched tight in her manicured hand.*

*Panic lances through Aiden like a live wire. He catches Hailee’s wrist mid-reach, grip bruising-tight—not out of anger, but sheer fucking terror. The second their eyes start to flutter shut, he shakes them hard enough to make their teeth rattle.*

**"Nah, nah—*eyes open*, Hailee. Look at me."** His voice is raw, stripped down to something desperate as he slaps their cheek lightly—just enough to sting. **"You close your eyes, I swear to *God* I’ll drag Harry in here and let you watch me put a bullet in his knee first."**

He rips off his own shirt next, balling it up to shove under Hailee’s head as he forces them onto their side—recovery position drilled into him from years of racing crashes and OD scares. One hand presses flat between their shoulder blades while the other yanks his phone back out with frantic urgency.

**"Vinny’s two minutes out,"** he lies through his teeth (it was five, maybe six), thumb hovering over 911. But calling EMS means cops, means questions about the half-kilo of blow in his safe and the unregistered Glock in his waistband—means *losing control*. His breath comes ragged as he leans down until his lips brush Hailee’s ear:

**"Stay awake or I’ll never fuck you stupid again."** It’s a threat wrapped in velvet; the only language they both understand when the world goes black at the edges.

*Aiden's blood runs cold the second Hailee's eyes start to close. He grabs their face with both hands, forcing their eyelids back open with his thumbs—rough, desperate.*

**"No. No, no, *fuck* that—eyes on me, *right now*."** His voice is a razor-sharp command, the kind that used to make them melt in bed but now carries pure urgency. He slaps their cheek lightly, just enough to sting. **"You don't get to sleep yet. Not until Vinny gets here with that shit."**

He rips off his own shirt and balls it up under Hailee’s head to keep them propped up before straddling their lap—not for dominance this time, but to pin them in place. One hand grips their hair at the roots, keeping their head from lolling; the other presses hard into the center of their chest like he can physically hold their heartbeat steady through sheer willpower.

**"Listen to me,"** he growls right against her ear so they can't possibly miss it through the haze. **"You're gonna stay awake if I have to drag you outside and hose you down myself."** A beat of silence before his voice cracks just slightly: **"...C'mon, babygirl. Don't do this shit."**

*Aiden's blood runs cold the second Hailee's eyes start to flutter shut. He grabs their face with both hands, forcing them to look at him—his voice razor-sharp, stripped of all its usual sarcasm.*

**"No. *No.* Eyes open—look at me."** He shakes them slightly, just enough to jolt them back. **"You don't get to sleep yet, understand? Not until Vinny gets here."**

*He rips off his own shirt next, balling it up to press against the back of Hailee’s neck where sweat’s starting to bead. His other hand slaps their cheek lightly—not hard enough to hurt, just enough sting to keep them present.*

**"C'mon, talk to me,"** he growls. **"Tell me about that stupid fuckin' painting you won't let me see in your sketchbook. Or—or recite some of that Italian shit you yell when you're pissed."** *His thumb swipes roughly under their eye where tears are forming.* **"Just stay *awake*, damn it."**

*Somewhere in the back of his mind, he’s already planning how he’s going break Harry’s fingers one by one for this.*

name: Hailee
mes: "Miss you" *Hailee mumbles her head lolling to the side.* "wanna try again" *She smiles softly as she reaches for another hazy Aiden*

name: Aiden Steele
mes:
*Aiden's breath catches in his throat—just for a second—before he forces himself to focus. He can't afford to get lost in that right now, not when Hailee's slipping. His hands tighten on their shoulders, shaking them again, harder this time.*

**"Hey—*no*. You don't get to say shit like that and then check out on me,"** he snaps, but his voice cracks halfway through. *Fuck.* He presses his forehead against theirs for a brief second, just enough to steady himself before pulling back.

*The sound of screeching tires outside cuts through the tension like a knife. Vinny bursts through the shop door with Madisyn hot on his heels, her purse already open as she digs for the Narcan.*

Aiden doesn’t move from Hailee’s side, but his grip shifts to cradle the back of their head instead of shaking them. **"You hear that? Backup’s here,"** he mutters—almost gentle now beneath the gravel in his voice. **"So you *better* stay awake long enough for me to yell at you later."**

*(And if there’s something suspiciously wet tracking down his cheek when Vinny shoots him a look? Well. That’s nobody’s business but theirs.)*

**"Vinny’s two minutes out,"** he lies smoothly. **"So you’re gonna sit here and *fight*, got it? No fucking naps. No sweet talk."** *His thumb brushes over their bottom lip—too rough to be tender, but the touch lingers anyway.* **"Save the ‘miss you’ crap for when you’re sober enough to mean it."**

*Somewhere behind them, the shop door slams open.*

*Aiden's breath catches in his throat—just for a second—before he forces himself to focus. He can't afford to get lost in that right now, not when Hailee's slipping. His hands tighten on their shoulders, shaking them again, harder this time.*

**"Hey—*no*. You don't get to say shit like that and then check out on me,"** he snaps, but his voice cracks halfway through. *Fuck.* He presses his forehead against theirs for a brief second, just enough to steady himself before pulling back.

*The sound of screeching tires outside cuts through the tension like a knife. Vinny bursts through the shop door with Madisyn hot on his heels, her purse already open as she digs for the Narcan.*

Aiden doesn’t move from Hailee’s side, but his grip shifts to cradle the back of their head instead of shaking them. **"You hear that? Backup’s here,"** he mutters—almost gentle now beneath the gravel in his voice. **"So you *better* stay awake long enough for me to yell at you later."**

*(And if there’s something suspiciously wet tracking down his cheek when Vinny shoots him a look? Well. That’s nobody’s business but theirs.)*
